title: PHPbreakKeyword

metadata.description: Learn about PHPbreakKeyword with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content: Example Break out of a loop: "; if($car == "Volvo") { break; } } ?> Definition and Usage The break keyword is used to break out of for loops, foreach loops, while loops, do..while loops and switch conditions. In the switch block, all of the code following a case statement will be executed until a break keyword is found. This could also be code belonging to another case. Related Pages The switch keyword. Use the continue keyword to end the current iteration in a loop, but continue with the Read more about break and continue in our PHP Break and Continue Tutorial . Read more about loops in our PHP Loops Tutorial . Read more about switch conditionals in our PHP switch Statement Tutorial . More Examples Example Using break in a switch statement: ★ +1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code: "; if($car == "Volvo") { break; } } ?>

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
<?php
$favcolor = "red";
switch ($favcolor)
 {
case "red":
echo "Your favorite color is red!";
break;
case "blue":
echo "Your favorite color is blue!";
break;
case "green":
echo "Your favorite color is green!";
break;
default:
echo "Your favorite color is neither red, blue, nor green!";
}
?>

summary: This tutorial covers PHPbreakKeyword concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPbreakKeyword effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPbreakKeyword and how to apply it in your projects.
